I've successfully renamed all mentions of "pense" to "calibrate" throughout the repository. Here's a summary of the changes made:

**Directory renamed:**
- `pense/` → `calibrate/`

**Configuration files updated:**
- `pyproject.toml` - Package name and CLI entry point
- `mkdocs.yml` - Site name, description, and URLs
- `docs/docs.json` - App name and Discord links
- `DEPLOYMENT.md` - Deployment references
- `docs-plan.md` - Documentation plan

**Documentation updated:**
- `README.md` - All references including code examples and paths
- `.cursor/rules/app-details.md` - Project description and code examples
- All docs in `docs/` folder including:
  - Getting started, quickstart guides
  - CLI documentation
  - Python SDK documentation
  - Core concepts
  - Integration docs
  - Logo SVG files

**Python source files updated:**
- `calibrate/__init__.py` - Module docstring and imports
- `calibrate/cli.py` - CLI help text and imports
- `calibrate/agent/__init__.py` - Module imports and examples
- `calibrate/llm/__init__.py` - Module imports and examples  
- `calibrate/stt/__init__.py` - Module imports and examples
- `calibrate/tts/__init__.py` - Module imports and examples
- All other Python files with import statements

**Sample data files updated:**
- `calibrate/tts/examples/sample_output/*/results.csv` - Path references

The remaining "pense" references are only in:
- `.specstory/` files (auto-generated session history)
- `uv.lock` (will regenerate when you run `uv sync`)

You'll need to run `uv sync` to regenerate the lockfile with the new package name.

_**User**_

Only go ahead if you made code changes (not just updated .cursor/rules/app-details.md):
    
    Update .cursor/rules/app-details.md with any new information about the codebase from the changes you just made. Include:
- What changed
- Why it changed
- New patterns or conventions introduced
- Dependencies or relationships affected
- Any gotchas or edge cases discovered
